data.description: Explores strategic marketing, branding, and communication planning specific to science, technology, and environmental industries. Examines the sociological and psychological processes shaping audiences' perceptions of various brands, and discusses how to apply various strategies and frameworks to reinforce these perceptions and guide marketing and communication efforts. Combines portfolio-building writing as well as in-class presentations and discussion on contemporary marketing, branding issues, including strategic marketing plans.
data.title: BRAND STRATEGY FOR THE SCIENCES

data.description: Economic problems of individuals, firms and industries with emphasis on value, price, and distribution of income.
data.title: PRINCIPLES OF MICROECONOMICS

data.description: Explores marketing, promotion, and strategic communication specific to the consumer marketplace. Analyze communication strategies for science products and industries synthesized from business goals and objectives to specific audiences. Coursework includes a variety of readings from a class textbook as well as peer-reviewed papers published in life science, marketing, communication, and general business journals.
data.title: MARKETING COMMUNICATION FOR THE SCIENCES

data.description: Integrated treatment of macroeconomics and microeconomics (seeECON 101andECON 102). Accelerated approach to economics training, especially for Economics: Math Emphasis majors.
data.title: PRINCIPLES OF ECONOMICS-ACCELERATED TREATMENT

data.description: Macroeconomic measurement and models of aggregate demand and supply; fiscal and monetary policy for unemployment, inflation, and growth.
data.title: PRINCIPLES OF MACROECONOMICS

data.description: Planning and controlling the elements of the marketing program; marketing organization, product and service, packaging, pricing, promotion and physical distribution.
data.title: MARKETING MANAGEMENT
